definitions.definition: to form or have a mental picture or idea of something:
examples: Imagine Robert Redford when he was young - that's what John looks like.

definitions.definition: to believe that something is probably true:
examples: [ + (that) ] I imagine (that) he's under a lot of pressure at the moment.

definitions.definition: to think that something exists or is true, although in fact it is not real or true:
examples: "Did you hear a noise?" "No, you're imagining things/No, you must have imagined it."

definitions.definition: used to express shock or surprise, often at someone else's behaviour:
examples: She got married at 16! Imagine that!
You can't imagine what a mess the house was in after the party.
